Dating: TUTHMOSIS III/MENKHEPERRE (not before); NEW KINGDOM ?; LATE PERIOD (not after)
Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE
Name: Scarab of Menkheperre
Description: This small scarab in blue faience comes from the excavations of Saft el-Henna undertaken by the "British School or Archaeology in Egypt" in 1906. It carries the coronation name of Thuthmosis III written in a cartouche and flanked by several hieroglyphic signs which are difficult to read. The dating of the piece is not certain.
